Name: Deep Madness: Lucas Kane Investigator
Description:
Expansion includes:

     Investigator Figure
     Investigator Card
     Activation Card

Name: Fire in the Library: Stellar Map
Description:
Promo card for Fire in the Library.

Playable after scoring (Book pile icon)

Robot Burns: Unicorn/Fables (purple) ribbon
Robot Scoring: Geography (white), History (Black), War (Yellow)

Text:
Score your Bravery Points from this round again. Draw two cards from the Tool Deck, keep one, and discard the other.

Name: Deep Madness: John Murdock Investigator
Description:
Expansion includes:

     Investigator Figure
     Investigator Card
     Activation Card

Name: Deep Madness: Ward Phillips Investigator
Description:
Expansion includes:

     Investigator Figure
     Investigator Card
     Activation Card

Name: Deep Madness: Evil Jon & Statues Card Pack
Description: Card pack used to make use of the Evil Jon (gray version) miniature of Jon along with the Statues from Uncounted Horrors.

Name: Candy Land Connect 4
Description:
It's a Game Mashup: Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. This Connect 4 game has a Candy Land twist. Players take turns knocking out plastic candies from the bottom row of the Connect 4 frame. Each time one gets knocked out, a new disc must be placed in one of the slots at the top of the frame. The plastic candy tokens keep moving out and dropping down as players try to get sets of 2, 3, or 4 candies adjacent to each other on the bottom row, or vertically up from the bottom. The Game Mashups Candy Land Connect 4 Game is a great idea for a birthday or holiday gift for boys and girls ages 6 and up.

—description from description

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The NAF Fun Police Promo Card
Description: This promo card was included in the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 3 other games. It is a "Dirty Trick" special play.

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance – Rudok Redz Promo Card
Description: This promo card was included in the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 3 other games. It is has the ability "Grot Bomb Ace."

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – The Miracle of Mars Promo Stratagem Card
Description: This promo card was included in the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 3 other games. It is a "Tricks and Tactics" Stratagem card.
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Ur-Predator Promo Card
Description: This promo card was included in the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 3 other games. It gives bonuses to movement and damage, among other things. It can only be used in games of Apex, new mode introduced in the magazine.

Name: Une Nounou en Fer
Description:
Une Nounou en fer ("An Iron Nanny") is a board game for all the family.

All players are babies that do not want to stay at bed, and want to cross the room to eat candies.
They will have to find their path through lying on the ground toys, avoiding dirty diapers and bad tricks from others players.
And most of all, be careful of the nanny that will try to catch you !

The use of the app is not mandatory but it will add more fun and surprises all along the game.

When it is your turn to play you have to choose 2 actions from 3 (actions must be different).

     Unveil a tile
     Orientate a tile already unveiled
     Move forward


Some tiles just show a path through toys (blue tiles) some other show a path and give you an extra bonus when you stop on it (orange tiles).
Bonus could be to jump over toys, do another action, move a diaper and so on..

When done, you can roll the nanny dice and move her accordingly. When nanny comes to a baby, she pushes him back from one tile. 
When a baby come back to his bed, he is so pissed off that he can launch a new dirty diaper on the boardgame.

First player to arrive on candies tile wins the game.

Name: Rumbbell FatDragon Invasion
Description:
Rumbbell FatDragon Invasion is a cooperative deck building game for 2 to 4 players. Players represent a group of Rumbbell Rangers, by using variety of sports and exercise cards, combined with the unique ability from each character to defend our world by eliminate the invasion of FatDragons attack with all kinds of overwhelming amount of food. Players can work together toward the goal, and pick up useful knowledge and information about exercises.

With thousands of FatDragons marching into our planet, now is up to the Rumbbell Rangers to save our world by promoting different type of sports and exercises. Stay healthy before it’s too late!

Name: Rifles in the Peninsula
Description:
Rifles in the Peninsula is the third game of the solitaire RIFLES series, which also includes Rifles in the Pacific and Rifles in the Ardennes. The focus of this new title is on the Napoleonic Wars (1799-1815).

The RIFLES system allows the recreation of small combat engagements (five to ten units per side), using an abstract map that represents the main features of the terrain like trees, buildings, hills. Placement of terrain features is guided but is never the same on each game, always creating new tactical challenges. The enemy strategy and the fog of war is recreated with the use of random Event Markers and “Activation Tables” that drive the enemy units toward their objective.

Rifles in the Peninsula introduces new rules to cover unique aspects of the Napoleonic Wars including mounted troops, formations, and the impact of the longer reload time of the weapons of the period (pistols, muskets, and rifles). The different attributes of the units (combat factors, quality, special traits) grenadiers, voltigeurs, cuirassiers and dragoons.

The Campaign game has been greatly redesigned and is now based on the timeline of the main campaigns of the period. The new Glory Track will represent the career of the Leader of your units, your avatar in the game, and your rank will have a direct influence on the game. Each year of the campaign includes four to six main “scenes”: a scene can trigger one Mission on the battlefield or a Campaign Event. Twelve different Missions are available, covering classical military duties like reconnaissance as well as iconic battle episodes like the capture of a gun. Campaign Events are resolved without the need to setup the battlefield and cover episodes like barrack inspections, field maneuvers and of course duels. As a bonus, an optional mini-game The Duel (inspired by the movie, The Duelists)has been included in the package: this mini-game allows players to re-create a saber duel with a more personal perspective, providing an additional level of immersion in the historical period.

From thundering muskets, to rattle of sabers, Rifles in the Peninsula vividly recreates Napoleonic skirmishes like never before.

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Marine Adventures: Recon Mission Pack Expansion
Description:
Space Marine Adventures is a fast-paced game for one to four players, set in the dark and dangerous labyrinth of the Necrons. This expansion gives you a new mission to undertake - Recon - and introduces three new Space Marines, each with their own unique wargear and skills.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Space Marine Adventures – Labyrinth of the Necrons

Name: Space Marine Adventures: Rescue Mission Pack Expansion
Description:
Space Marine Adventures is a fast-paced game for one to four players, set in the dark and dangerous labyrinth of the Necrons. This expansion gives you a new mission to undertake - Rescue - and introduces three new Space Marines, each with their own unique wargear and skills.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Space Marine Adventures – Labyrinth of the Necrons

Name: Ritual
Description:
2-5 minions of evil ancient deities come together to attempt to break the seals keeping them at bay and awakening them in 3 Rituals (rounds of play). Typically this is done by "following the suit" of play, with a twist.  If everyone plays ritual chant cards matching the current "spell", everyone gets a point.  If, however, someone differs, committing an 'evil act' against the others, the one who played the differing chant (least in kind) ALONE gets a point.

BUT...if everyone plays a different chant spell, you gain Insanity.  3 insanity points and you are out.

One last twist: If everyone IN UNITY plays the same kind of spell chant that is different from the needed spell, you all get a point.

No communication is allowed between players, you just have to use your wits to determine what you will do...

—description from the publisher

Name: Mortals
Description:
Be the final survivor in this post-apocalyptic action game. On a dying planet, two teams battle the clock, stealing time from each other to live longer. It’s the final countdown! Who will prevail? Oh, and watch out for the Zombies!

Mortals is a fast-paced turn-based strategy game played with Blinks. 
 Each Blink (tile) starts with 60 seconds to live and players take turns stealing life from opponents tiles.

If a tile moves alone it goes into attack mode and with each move, it can steal life from opponents connected tile.
The attacking piece gains 5 seconds per connection.

An attacking tile will steal from every tile including its own team. Sacrificing one tile to prolong the life of others is a common tactic.

Turns proceed into all Blinks are dead.

As each Blink begins to die, each tile becomes a zombie and drains life from any connected tile.

The last surviving Blink is the winner.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tavern Masters: Songs From The Tavern (Soundtrack CD)
Description:
Tavern Masters: Songs From The Tavern soundtrack was composed by Caden L. Welborn, with each Song card from the Dockside Expansion being represented in full song on the soundtrack.

Each song sounds like listening to an entertainer performing in an old tavern. Each song is different in style, and each is crafted with rich ambiance to give you an immersive experience while playing Tavern Masters, other World Of Destiny games, or even your favorite role-playing game!

The soundtrack even comes with 3 exclusive Song cards for your Dockside expansion, each available no where else, each card also taken from a track featured on the CD.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mazmorras de Puestosombrío
Description:
Powerful evil creatures have been imprisoned in a magical dungeon for a millennium. But over time, the magical protection has worn thin, and the monsters are about to escape and wreath havoc on the nearby town of Puestosombrio. The players are entering the dungeon to defeat the ancient evil and save the town.

The players explore the dungeon, which is laid out from cards. When they meet monsters, they can attack them, using their personal stats and equipment to modify their single die roll. Defeating monsters lets the players collect new powers and gain treasure, but the final boss monster also gains strength throughout the game. The goal is to eventually defeat this boss monster.

Name: The Runelords Board Game
Description:
The Runelords Board Game is a hybrid tabletop gaming experience for one to four players based in the world of the best-selling fantasy series by legendary author, David Farland.

Players first choose from four dynamic runelords, each with their own reinforcement cards that have a physical presence on the battlefield (standees) and support cards with additional spells and abilities that are drawn and played from a hand during battle.

Reinforcements are sent into hex-based combat where players will enjoy simple but robust tactical engagement with win conditions based on the game mode chosen from the Battle Compendium before play.

What makes this game so unique is Sovereignty! Sovereignty is a stage of play where players take the pre-built armies of their selected runelords and mash them into a deckbuilding, resource management engine.  Then, after several rounds of play, players will take the armies they've built onto the battlefield for a unique, more strategic gaming experience!

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: HMS Victory
Description:
HMS Victory was a terrible and awe-inspiring sight to both enemies and allies. It has become one of the most famous ships in the world and is still in commission in the Royal Navy to this day; as of 2019 a total of 241 years of service.

In the Game

H.M.S Victory is a potent force on the tabletop. Aside from a formidable array of weaponry and fantastic resilience, her inspiring presence confers a bonus to all nearby friendly ships when they are required to take a skill test. If Nelson is present, this bonus is augmented yet further!

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: HMS Royal Sovereign
Description:
HMS Royal Sovereign was a 1st Rate Ship-of-the-Line of the Royal Navy, bearing 100 guns. She was launched from Plymouth Dockyard in 1786 and developed somewhat of a poor reputation from her crew, supposedly dubbed "West Country Wagon" owing to poor manoeuvrability and speed.

Prior to her famous role at the Battle of Trafalgar, she participated in the battles of "The Glorious First of June" as the flagship of Vice-Admiral Thomas Graves, and was Cornwallis' flagship in his famous retreat of 16 June 1795. In the latter battle, after a day's pursuit, a far larger French fleet came within firing range of the entire Brtish fleet.

Realising the danger to his rearguard, Cornwallis brought Royal Sovereign southwards imposing his vessel between the two fleets, using the power of the 1st rate's broadside to dissuade the pursuing French. In doing so, he managed to delay the French long enough until the appearance of an unknown fleet spooked the French into their own retreat.

In Game:

HMS Royal Sovereign is an exceptionally powerful 1st Rate in the game. Beware the brunt of her broadside, particularly if you choose to include Admiral Collingwood as a character in your fleet. His presence will allow his ship and friendly vessels near, to re-roll its initial broadside. This gives you a distinct advantage for this crucial portion of any battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Royal Navy 1st Rate
Description:
A Royal Navy 1st rate is a particularly dangerous foe in Black Seas, especially true when using the National Special Rules. In the game, 1st rates have the best access to customisation and upgrade options. Combine certain upgrades (we're fans of Master Gunner) with the British 'Drilled' special rule and your 1st rate will truly be an unstoppable force - but don't go into battle unsupported!

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: L'Orient
Description:
Orient was of the Océan-class of ships. These were a series of 118-gun three-decker ships of the line of the French Navy, designed by engineer Jacques-Noël Sané. Launched on July 20, 1791, she was originally named the Dauphin Royal, but having come into service during a time of great political upheaval, she was promptly renamed. As a tribute to a political movement, she was dubbed the Sans-Culotte. She retained this name for three years before it also became contentious.

In the Game

Orient is an extremely powerful 1st Rate Flagship on the tabletop. Woe betides the enemy that suffers the full brunt of her broadside. Remember that you can only take a limited number of 1st rate ships in a Black Seas fleet, therefore Orient provides an impressive and powerful centrepiece for your French fleet.

She also receives a very characterful set of special rules in the game, gaining a combat bonus when facing British ships, and if should she ever catch fire, she will immediately explode as per her famous historical demise.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: French 1st Rate
Description:
1st Rate ships of the line were extremely large and powerful and were a true display of a Navy's power. They were, however, expensive to operate, so their service use was limited in times of peace. In the carronade era, a 1st Rate ship-of-the-line was defined as mounting no less than 100 guns.

A French Navy 1st Rate can, when using the national special rules, be an extremely resilient foe to dislodge from battle. French ships have access to the 'sturdy' upgrade for a discount, and thus have a significant number of ship point to chew through. Of course, 1st rates are generally very powerful, but point for point, a French 1st rate should be sticking around longer to wreak havoc among your enemy's formations.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Santisima Trinidad
Description:
The Santisima Trinidad (officially named Nuestra Señora de la Santísima Trinidad) was a Spanish first-rate ship of the line. This number of guns increased over the years. At launch in 1769, she had 112 guns, though this number gradually increased. between 1795 and 1796 she was upgraded to 130 guns, and in 1802 this number was increased to 140. Following this last rebuild, she was the heaviest armed ship in the world, bearing more guns than any other ship in the Age of Sail. Effectively, however, the fourth gundecks guns were comparatively small.

This armament was not without its problems. The weight of the additional weaponry rendered her a particularly poor at sail, leading to the ultimately rejected suggestion that she be restricted to the defence of the Bay of Cadiz. She remains notable as one of the very few 4-decked ships ever built.

In the game:
The vast bulk of the Santisima Trinidad is alluded to with its special rules in Black Seas - she is only ever able to make a single change of direction during her activation. She also requires a successful skill test to be able to travel at full sails.

The trade-off for this deficiency is an arsenal that dwarfs any other ship in the game. Any vessel unfortunate enough to be caught in the broadside is sure to be shredded. You'll want to capitalize on this as best you can, unleashing your initial broadside (which conveys additional bonuses) at the optimal moment.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: USS Constitution
Description:
USS Constitution was one of six Heavy Frigates commissioned by the United States Congress in 1794 to protect American shipping against Barbary Pirates in the Mediterranean. These frigates were designed to outmatch the frigates of any other nation while remaining nimble enough to slip away from larger ships-of-the-line.

These six frigates (Chesapeake, Constitution, President, United States, Congress, and Constellation. Chesapeake, Constitution, President and United States) were armed with 44 guns, normally a mix of long 24-pounders and 32-pound carronades. Across their service life, these ships would often end up over gunned, carrying upwards of 50 guns into battle.

Revolutionary construction techniques gave the six frigates much thicker hull planking than their British or French equivalents, allowing them to soak up a tremendous amount of punishment. It also allowed them to carry a much heavier armament relative to their size, as seen by the arrays of 24 and 32-pounders carried on the 44 gun vessels.

In the Game:

USS Constitution should be in the thickest fighting on the table, leading the charge into the enemy battle line, using her exceptional survivability to weather the storm of shot and shell while blasting away with her own guns.

While she might not be able to tangle with larger First Rates like Victory, she can hold her own in frigate actions, tying up the enemy fleet while the remainder of your ships go after other objectives or gain a more advantageous position.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Gunboat Squadron
Description:
A gunboat squadron is like a gnat in comparison to the larger ships-of-the-line. Nevertheless, they have a useful place in the fleet. A gunboat would typically have only a single mast with square-rigged sails, mounting between one and three fixed cannons.

Fleets of all navies kept gunboats on hand. They could be useful in shallower waters, as with only a single mounted cannon, they were able to manoeuvre relatively easily where a large ship could not. If this cannon was a 32-pounder it could still prove dangerous to larger vessels. For instance, a frigate could easily destroy a single gunboat with a single broadside hit. But if deployed in large numbers, the frigate would struggle to deal with every gunboat before sustaining heavy damage itself. The extremely cheap cost and relative time is taken to build these gunboats could prove a tremendous advantage.

Gunboats were crucial to Napoleon's notion for the planned invasion of England in 1804, whilst the US Navy's policy between 1803 and 1812 focussed its Navy around the concept - this was to prove ineffectual against the British Blockade in the war of 1812.

In the Game

In Black Seas, Gunboat squadrons are tiny vessels. This means that they are extremely difficult to hit, but are vulnerable to collisions from larger vessels, particularly if that vessel was travelling at speed. They mount only a single light cannon and are too small to allow for upgrades  - their relative evasiveness, however, means that they will be difficult to deal with in battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Frigates & Brigs Flotilla (1770 - 1830)
Description:
Frigates

Frigates were perhaps the hardest-worked of warship types during the Age of Sail.  A small warship with a perfect balance of speed, armament and resilience that made it one of the perfect vessels for single-ship action and privateering against merchant ships. It usually had one main gun deck as well as the guns positioned on the top decks. These were categorised as either 5th or 6th rate within the British Rating System, dependent on the number of guns they mounted.

The 5th rates were the archetypal frigates of the period. Used for single-ship actions and privateering, they could make their crews very rich as a result of the share of the prize money for any captured ship. A frigate was a desirable posting for a Royal Navy officer as they often saw action, so glory and promotion were more likely in addition to monetary benefits.

Frigates scouted for the fleet, went on commerce-raiding missions and patrols, and conveyed messages and dignitaries. Usually, frigates would fight in small numbers or singly against other frigates. They would avoid contact with ships-of-the-line; Indeed, even in the midst of a fleet engagement, it was bad etiquette for a ship of the line to fire on an enemy frigate which had not fired first... Wargamers take note!

Brig

A two-masted square-rigged vessel, with between 10 and 18 cannons, frequently used in combat actions by various navies. Ships with less than 20 cannons were considered Unrated. These were not really meant to participate in large battles – that was the domain of the ships of the line. However, they were the vessels of choice for privateers and still played a valuable role during larger battles, relaying orders and messages in a similar fashion to the 6th rates.

The Frigates & Brigs Flotilla box contains all you need to get these vessels to the tabletop. These are suitable for navies of any nation. The kit includes a bobbin for rigging your vessels, detailed sails and pennants for every nation, as well as all the gaming materials for using the vessels in your games of Black Seas.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: 3rd Rates Squadron (1770 - 1830)
Description:
A 3rd rate ship, as defined by the British rating system, was a ship of the line which mounted between 64-80 guns. Usually, this would mean two gun decks. Despite their relative size and power compared to larger 1st and 2nd rates, it was considered that 3rd rates maintained an effective, perhaps even superior balance between sailing ability, firepower and cost.

For a number of nations, 3rd rates were the most popular ship size. Cheaper to operate and easier to sail without the sacrifice of offensive capability, the only ships a 3rd rate could not single-handedly engage were larger three-decked ships. A large number of 3rd rates were built and employed on a variety of missions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Premier Empire v3
Description:
Miniatures rules to simulate French Revolutionary and First Empire Wars.

For 6 / 15 / 25mm miniatures

Division / Corps level

Features:


     3 levels of play: tactical / grand tactical / operational
     orders to group of units
     no written orders, simplified system using counters
     combat resolution per unit
     cohesion system impacting troop morale and efficiency
     fast resolution of fire and melees


—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: An Adventure in Science
Description:
An electronic question and answer game where the board has 24 contacts - 12 for questions and 12 for answers. When the player matches the correct answer with the question a light bulb will flash. Questions relate to the sciences, human body and the natural world. The questions sheets are changeable on the board.

—user summary

Name: Guess Who? Clue Game
Description:
It's a Game Mashup: Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. This Guess Who? game has a Clue twist. The game is packed with suspense as players try to guess the suspect, murder weapon, and scene of the crime. By asking yes or no questions about their opponent's cards in the grid, they'll uncover the mystery by process of elimination. Ready to solve the mystery? Make a correct accusation to win.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Terraforming Mars: French Championship Promo Cards
Description:
These two fan made promo cards were distributed during the 2019 Terraforming Mars France championship, organized by the association Ludophiles d'Asnières et d'Ailleurs and overseen by Intrafin.

"Cité hydraulique" was distributed to each participant; "Ludophiles d'Asnières et d'Ailleurs" to the 16 finalists.

Rules
- Cité hydraulique (Hydraulic city):
Requires 5 oceans. Place a city tile on an ocean tile. Decrease your energy production 1 step. The ocean tile beneath your city is still considered as an ocean.
Draw one card per two oceans on the board.

- Ludophiles d'Asnières et d'Ailleurs (corporation):
You start with 50 M€.
Effect: Duplicate the effect or the action of one of the corporations discarded by your opponents (production, ressources and are ignored).

Name: Vorwärts und rückwärts
Description:
The players have to move their pawns from their starting spaces to the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. To enter a pawn into the game a 1 has to be rolled. On the roll of an even number, the pawn moves forward. An odd number causes the pawn to move backwards.

If a pawn has reached it's own spaces marked with a "+" it doesn't have to move backwards anymore. The spaces marked with 1,2,3 or 6 eyes have to be reached in sequence by a roll of this number.

The first player to get all 4 pawns to their destination wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Star Thieves
Description:
Star Thieves is a science fiction heist board game, first developed and released in 2013.

Set in the year 2595, aboard a futuristic space station - physically represented by a medium-sized hexagonal board - up to eight players are directed to navigate towards the crux of the game, the Black Star Diamond, located at the center. Players are dealt a small hand of cards that are categorized as "Equipment", "Action" and "PvP" - the last of which is inaccessible throughout this first phase called "Heist Mode". During this time, players must overcome obstacles, including doors and turrets, while also accounting for treachery dealt by their opponents.

Once the Black Star Diamond has been snatched, the board resets into "PvP Mode", which allows for players to utilize their generally lethal PvP cards, to pursue the jewel's carrier. The player to return to their starting hexagon dubbed the "Spawn Point" wins the game.

Designed by Samuel Horton, Tobias Phelps and Ryan Brock, the game was intended to emulate the tone of a multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) - a video game - title, with heist being the central mechanic. The game was inspired predominantly by Dota 2, Scrolls, Pathfinder Roleplaying Game (1st Edition) and Gloom.

In 2019, American film & video game developer Botto Entertainment acquired the intellectual property rights to Star Thieves.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team Annual 2019
Description:
Kill Team Annual 2019 is your one-stop-shop for all the latest Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team and content. Whether you're looking to compile all of the rules that have featured in White Dwarf magazine throughout the year, or are looking for something new to expand your gaming experience, this is the perfect gaming supplement for you! Inside this year’s copy, you'll find:


     A full points compilation of every datasheet, Commander and item of wargear released to date.
     Rules for using Adepta Sororitas, Kroot Mercenary and Chaos Daemons kill teams, as well as those using the explorers and adversaries from Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress
     Guidelines for creating your own specialisms, offering you the freedom to give your kill team even more of a narrative edge.
     And much, much more…


Experiment with new rules, build your own kill teams, try new missions – however you play, the Kill Team Annual is packed with everything you'll need to take your favourite skirmish combat game to the next level!

—description from publisher

Name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers – Big Racer Expansion
Description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Racer expansions. Each Racer brings unique "Abilities" and "Powers" of their own to the game. Collect ALL 13 Racer Expansions for the ultimate Sonic collection!

—description from the publisher
Families: Video Game Theme: Sonic the Hedgehog

Name: SENTO: Ultimate Arcade Fighter
Description:
Your challenger stands across from you as you enter the arena. Only one of you will walk away as champion. FIGHT!

SentÅ: Ultimate Arcade Fighter is a fresh take on the classic arcade fighter! SentÅ is the first tabletop game to capture the puzzle fighter experience, and bring it from the digital space to the analog.

SentÅ is a fighting game with a vibrant cast of worldly characters. Each character brings their own asymmetric style and abilities to each match. Play as a chef with powers over ice and fire, a trickster magician with manipulative mind games, or a lively DJ dropping powerful beats!

On your turn, activating your attack is as simple as clearing a chain of same colored connected marbles from the dispenser. Your character's unique attack list will tell you what attack they perform based on the number and color of marbles cleared. Use your attacks wisely to hinder your opponent, accelerate your own unique systems, manipulate the board, and deal damage to your opponents' health gauge buttons! Each time you break a button, they must insert 1 of their 5 coins into the arcade cabinet (marble dispenser). When there are no more coins to insert, it's game over!

Each player has 3 buttons. These buttons act as health gauges, one for each color of ability and marble (Red, Yellow, and Blue.) When dealing damage, you decide which button to damage, and once a button is brought down to 0, you break it and disable your opponent's access to those attacks! However, broken buttons allow you to "Short-circuit" through marbles of that color (essentially making them linking marbles), allowing a weakened opponent to more easily activate their hardest hitting attacks in their remaining colors. Your buttons will recover as you "Short-circuit" through same colored marbles, and can be re-activated at the beginning of any turn. But do so too early and they could get broken again quickly, burning another coin!

A player is knocked out once they have no more coins to insert, but be careful. If a button is broken while having other buttons out of commission, you must insert a coin for each broken button! You'll need to carefully balance aggression and caution in this quick-action puzzle-driven fighting game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Switch-a-king
Description:
Deduce, confuse and keep your eye on those goal cards as you and everyone else moves them around the table. Whomever has the king meeple at the end wins.

At the start every player gets a hidden goal card and a hand of actions cards.

On your turn play one action card from your hand on the table and say out loud which of the two actions you want to use: top or bottom. This action is resolved. Play continues to your left.

Keep playing until the last action card is played or the effect of the last round action is resolved. Turnover the goal cards to see who has managed the get the king meeple.

—description from the designer

Name: 2d6vs2d6 Dice Baseball
Description:
Baseball as simulated by four standard six-sided dice, for one or two players. Two dice are designated as the "Away" team, and two dice are designated the "Home" team. The game starts with Away team as batter/runners, and Home team as pitcher/fielders. In the outcomes grid, Batter/runners values designate the row, the Pitcher/fielders designate the column, with the resulting cell determining the outcome.

—description from the designer

Name: Copenhagen: Expansion 1 – Abilities & Missions
Description:
The Missions & Abilities expansion includes three modules.

Missions: Two missions are randomly selected each game, and give players more ways to earn points.

New Abilities: Six new special abilities are added to the game. They may be mixed with the original abilities, or players may use the Advanced Rules to form an abilities market.

Joker Tiles: Joker tiles may be placed over already placed pieces to add a window, or they may be placed on the facade, where they are wild for every color.

Originally included in the Copenhagen Kickstarter edition of the Deluxe and Collector's edition.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rune Stones: Enchanted Forest
Description:
Rune Stones: Enchanted Forest includes two expansion modules:


     Familiars: Players may forfeit the action of a card in order to move their familiar deeper into the enchanted forest. By doing so they may collect magical toadstools and receive some bonuses that will help them on their quest. Players will also receive points at the end of the game based on their position along the track.



     Rune Influx: Eight new types of Rune Stones that can be added to the game, as well as optional rules for bringing Rune Stones into play.

Name: Jeu du Cochonnet
Description:
Each player gets a little pig.

The goal of the game is to remove all parts (4 legs, 1 tail, 2 ears, 2 eyes, 1 head) of the pig, then reinstall them, using the dice. 
Dice have parts of a pig on each face.

—user summary

Name: The Closest Ghost
Description:
You and your best friend are exploring a haunted house on Halloween. Suddenly, a ghost pops up and you both drop your trick-or-treat bags, scattering your precious candies all around you. The first player to finish picking up their candy wins — but be sure to watch out for ghosts!

Can be played with real candy, which you eat as you collect it.

The board is made of two Looney Ludo boards / Martian coasters.

Players take turns moving their own avatar piece, removing any candy they land on, and then moving the closest ghost. Win when your half of the board has no more candy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Caveman Clash
Description:
A simple set of miniatures skirmish rules allowing bands of cavemen to fight against one another or prehistoric megafauna.

—user summary

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Grave Coffins
Description:
Fresh from the DarkStone Forge, we are excited to present the Limited Edition Grave Coffins Set!  This set includes 3D versions of the Coffin Tokens found in the Feral Vampires Mission Pack and can be used to replace these tokens with Vampire Mission Pack missions.  But, this set also includes an exclusive new mission: "Grave Robbers" which does not use Vampires (the Feral Vampires Mission Pack is not required to use this product).

New Mission - "Grave Robbers"

The nearby graveyards have been hit hard lately, with someone... or something, digging up coffins and carrying them off in the night. No one knows who’s doing it or why, but with that many coffins and bodies going missing, it can’t be good! As the local sheriff was actually in one of those coffins, it’s up to you now to put a stop to this gruesome enterprise.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Enemy Traits Pack #3 Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Trait cards are used to give a particular enemy type more diversity (and often a bit more danger). This is the third in a series of Trait Packs that re-visit established enemies from Shadows of Brimstone, adding unique new traits to them, and making them feel different each time you encounter them! This Card Supplement contains a set of trait cards for three different enemies from the original City of the Ancients Core Set of Shadows of Brimstone: Stranglers, Night Terrors, and Tentacle Enemies.

This 16-card card supplement adds a collection of Enemy Traits for Stranglers, Night Terrors, and Tentacle Enemies for Shadows of Brimstone.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Enemy Supplement #1
Description:
The Scafford Gang Enemy Supplement #1

The Scafford Gang are one of the most dangerous bands of outlaws in the West! Ruthless Mutants lead by Colonel Scafford and his trusty Lieutenants, the Scafford Gang robs trains and towns across the countryside, making their hideouts in the caves and abandoned mines up in the hills. Former Confederates in the Civil War, they despise the law and use their hideous mutations to fill their pockets with gold and Dark Stone.

This sets adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for 2 of the dangerous Scafford Lieutenants – Sergeant Bunker and ‘Fast Draw’ Jeb Scafford, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. It also includes a couple of new outlaw-themed Gear and Artifact cards, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Scafford themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Lieutenants with their gang.

This game supplement enhances the Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack and Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack, as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for Sergeant Bunker and ‘Fast Draw’ Jeb Scafford.

—description from the publisher

CONTENTS

     Sgt. Bunker Enemy Sheet
     'Fast Draw' Jeb Scafford Enemy Sheet
     Card #231 Old Keys (Gear)
     Card #333 Brace of Dark Stone Pistols (Mine Artifact)
     Card #458 Sgt. Bunker and D3+1 Scafford Gang (Low Threat)
     Card #459 Sgt. Bunker, D6 Scafford Gang and 1 Dark Stone Brute (Medium Threat)
     Card #460 Sgt. Bunker, PD Scafford Gang and D3 Dark Stone Brutes (High Threat)
     Card #461 Sgt. Bunker, PD Scafford Gang and D3 Dark Stone Brutes (Epic Threat)
     Card #462 'Fast Draw' Jeb Scafford and D3+1 Scafford Gang (Low Threat)
     Card #463 'Fast Draw' Jeb Scafford, D6 Scafford Gang and 1 Dark Stone Brute (Medium Threat)
     Card #464 'Fast Draw' Jeb Scafford, PD Scafford Gang and D3 Dark Stone Brutes (High Threat)
     Card #465 'Fast Draw' Jeb Scafford, PD Scafford Gang and D3 Dark Stone Brutes (Epic Threat)

Name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers – Blaze Racer Expansion
Description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Racer expansions. Each Racer brings unique "Abilities" and "Powers" of their own to the game. Collect ALL 13 Racer Expansions for the ultimate Sonic collection!

—description from the publisher
Families: Video Game Theme: Sonic the Hedgehog

Name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers – Charmy Racer Expansion
Description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Racer expansions. Each Racer brings unique "Abilities" and "Powers" of their own to the game. Collect ALL 13 Racer Expansions for the ultimate Sonic collection!

—description from the publisher

Name: De Reuzendans
Description:
De Reuzendans ("The Giants' Dance") is a family game for 2-5 players from the age of 8. The theme is the European tradition of the Giants of the Guilds.

Dendermonde, a Belgian city, is the proud owner of three Giants. These Giants are not only famous for their beautiful looks, but also because of their graceful dancing. Believe it or not but each giant is carried by a porter.

In this game you are a Giant and go around in the city of Dendermonde. At the famous squares you try to outclass the other Giants with your best dance. Each turn you play a card to make a 'move' and you can play cards to 'dance'.

Because every player had the same stack of cards, you can only win with a good timing of your moves, a bit of luck and you have to pick your battles, your dance battles.

—description from the designer

Name: Disarm The Base
Description:
Disarm The Base is a quick, co-operative game based on direct action. Players need to find and disarm war planes on a base, both avoiding the guards and disarming all the planes before the deck runs out.

Play takes place on a game board representing the base. Tiles representing different war planes are placed face down in hangars on the board. Each turn, players take up to four actions, which include moving around the base, playing cards from their hand, or giving or taking cards. Players then draw cards from a deck, resolving red cards immediately and taking other cards into their hands. Red cards do unfavorable things such as closing gates, placing guards in hangars, and turning on lights; cards in hand allow actions such as unlocking hangars, opening gates, turning off lights, and (of course) disarming planes. At the end of your turn, a guard on the perimeter of the board moves one space.

Players win if they disarm all the planes and at least one player escapes the base. To do that, players need to move around the board, use a code card or a crowbar card to open a hangar, enter the hangar, use a code card or a bolt cutter card to disarm the plane, leave the hangar, find the rest of the planes, and finally get out of the base back to where the banners were left! Players don't know which hangars contain planes, and every plane differs. If the deck runs out of cards, the supply runs out of guards, or more than one player is discovered by a guard, the players lose.

Name: Stadium Dice
Description:
You are a fearless Gladiator!  You now have a team of your own Gladiators (10 dice) that you enter into battle against other teams in the arena.  After each battle (round) is over, teams are scored based on the dice and their position in the arena.  After the final round, the Gladiator with the highest-scoring team wins!

The rules are simple and fast to learn (takes about a minute), but the action is engaging and addictive.  Great for games AND non-gamers.  Fun for small groups, parties, families, etc.  It really levels the playing field and is all-inclusive: 6 year-olds have legitimately beaten adults, and groups who didn't even speak the same language truly enjoyed playing together.

The game includes 8" high stadium walls that flex to accommodate 5 different stadium formats: circle, oval, octagon, square and rectangle.  Each floor is reversible, providing varying scoring options for different playing strategies.  The Kickstarter base game comes with the walls, 2 reversible floors, 8 teams of dice (80 total), a limited edition decal of one of the 8 named Gladiators, instruction booklet and custom art.

—description from the designer

Name: Hattu Möhrchen
Description:
Players take the role of bunnies which start with 10 carrots each. Through card play, they try to make the other players lose carrots. Last player with any carrots left wins the game.

Game play is similar to Uno, played over several short rounds. At the start of each round, every player gets a hand of 6 cards. In his turn, a player can discard a card that matches the number or color of the top card in the discard pile. If he is unable to do so, he has to draw a card. When one player has no cards left, the other players have to pay one carrot for each card left in their hands. Then a new round starts.

Special rules: When a player is unable to play a card, he not only has to draw one, but also to stand up. When he plays a card in a later turn, he sits down again. There is a quite large number of special cards that allow to steal one carrot from each player that is currently standing. Other special cards make all other players stand up, or try to steal a carrot from a specific player.

A player without any carrots left is immediately out of the game. Winner is the last player with any carrots left.

—user summary

Name: Race for the Meuse: Battle for Bodange, Belgium, 10 May 1940
Description:
A historical module scenario pack for Advanced Squad Leader from Lone-Canuck Publishing.

In the early morning hours of 10 May 1940, a single code-word “Danzig” was transmitted to German forces and at 04:30 hours, German panzers rumbled westward across the border into the Low Countries, heralding the start of the Blitzkrieg in the West. Without encountering significant obstacles, the reconnaissance elements of the 1.Panzerdivision raced across Luxembourg, crossing the 50 kilometres, even before the inhabitants were awake, and reaching the Belgian frontier at Martelange at 07.45 hours. The German plan foresaw an attack on Martelange by Marschgruppe Voraus – a motorcycle company supported by armoured cars - then an attack on Bodange by the entire Advance Guard.

This tactical mission (TM) revolves around the efforts of the Belgian 5th Company, 1er Regiment de Chasseurs Ardennais'  valiant attempt to slow the Germans' Race for the Meuse River. This TM is compatible with MMP's ASL System and modifiable to be used with other miniature Wargaming systems.

The Tactical Mission Pack comes with 1x Tactical Mission (a.k.a. Campaign Game) + 5 Scenario played on a historically based (24½"x 35" with standard ASL 7/8" hexes) map of the Sure River Valley; between the villages of Wisembach and Bodange, located 3-kilometres west of the Belgian-Luxembourg border.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Origin
Description:
Part trivia, part poker, Origin pits buffs against bluffs in a game where collusion and charisma trample the truth for personal benefit. It's been said that if you can master this game, you can run a country. Not an important country, but still... nice to know.

The cards represent historical events, and the object is to win other players' cards by proving your event occurred closest to the date of the judge's event. Of course, since you'll rarely have the right card, the game isn’t about what you’ve got -- it's about what other players think you’ve got. Make it convincing.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ti non es de aquí?
Description:
Ti non es de aquí? is a board game in traditional board format, cards with questions and cards, in which it is tried to test the knowledge that the participants have about Galiza, answering questions about different aspects of the nation, divided into 5 blocks or thematic areas:

Language, literature, biographies, literary awards, Días das Letras, toponymia...
Prehistory, suevians, priscilian, middle age, the irmandiños, politics...
Monuments, heritage, painting, sculpture, architecture, museums, ethnography...
Music, cinema, television, radio, awards, sports, festivals...
Geography, celebrations, fishing, agriculture, industry, gastronomy, fauna, flora...

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
First of all, finish the route of the board, a route on the Galizan map, answering as many questions as possible.

It is designed for people with an average cultural knowledge about Galiza. Children from 14 years of age will be able to play, although students from the secondary school will be ideal.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sports Arena
Description:
17 SPORTS OF ALL SORTS 
for 1,2,3, or 4 players

The Sports Arena is the world’s most versatile gameboard. 
There are games to delight all ages and all temperaments-games to suit your every mood: hilarious games and quiet games, games of luck and games of skill, games of precision and games of speed, games of physical coordination and games of strategy. For a frolic, a fracas, or a fray, Sports Arena is tops.

THRILLS!!!
-A WIDE VARIETY!!!

Standing targets blasted in fast shooting contests of fire-power!

Standing targets strategically maneuvered in battles of wit!

Moving targets delight sportsmen with problems of leading, timing, judgement of distance, and hand-eye coordination!

Bobbing targets that lurch, dart, and roll in circles!

—description from the rulebook

Name: Monopoly Jenga
Description:
When Monopoly meets Jenga... collect the most property and railroad blocks before the tower falls!

This game plays similarly to the classic block balancing dexterity game Jenga, but the blocks are painted and some represent different properties you can collect, and you win points for complete sets. Other blocks, such as Chance and Community Chest, have abilities such as letting you steal blocks from opponents.

The game even allows players to trade properties, just like the classic Monopoly.

When the tower crashes the winner is the player with the most points.

Name: Paper Against The Office 3 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
What's better than 2 really good things?  3 really good things!  The 3rd version of our popular game Paper Against The Office!

Order yours now to be among the first to get this great game!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.

Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

—description from the publisher

Name: Friends Against Friends (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
A brand new game from the creators of Paper Against The Office!  Friends Against Friends is the next great game you should have on your shelf at home!

Order yours now to be among the first to get this great game!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.

Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

—description from the publisher

Name: Detectives Looking Chart
Description:
It is a spot-in type of game for 2 or more players/teams. The game includes two playing options and other variants.

Content:

     1 assembling game board
     12 detective markers
     60 pcs detective rings
     1 hourglass
     60 clue cards


The game board features around 100 different object illustrations. 3 items are shown on a clue card. Players race to locate the clue items and put a marker on the located objects. Mode 1: Players compete with a shared clue card. Mode 2: Each player has his own clue card to race.

Name: Meine ersten Spiele: Hallo Töpfchen!
Description:
The players help Pippa or Paul get to the potty in a hurry. The dice decides, either the potty moves closer or the children have to take another drink. But if we’re not quick, there is going to be an accident. The players work together to become real potty professionals.

—description from the publisher

Name: YOHO (You Only Hang Once)
Description:
YOHO (You Only hang Once) is a non-cooperative card game where each player takes on the role of a notorious pirate, stuck on a ship of thieves and liars.

Someone has stolen the crew’s stolen treasure and will be punished when their treachery is exposed! Your goal is to avoid walking the plank – by blaming someone else – AND make off with the treasure!

The deck of Blame cards will help incriminate your rivals. Each card gives BLAME to a specific Rank (Captain, Quartermaster, Bosun, Seadog and Pariah) and the pirate holding the most BLAME at the end of the game will be thrown in the sea.

Each turn you play a Blame card and follow its instructions. You can get a crew-mate demoted, change their loyalty, throw a wild accusation or bury your shameful secrets (or the treasure). If there are enough rebels, you can even start a mutiny and become the new Captain!

—description from the designer

Name: My Very First Games: Nibble Munch Crunch
Description:
What does a cat, a tortoise, or a mouse eat? And which foods taste best for a rabbit or a dog? The children can work together or apart to find out in this collection of small games. Match the animal cards, wooden food pieces, cut-out cards, and color cards together to feed all the pets. They’ll have the animals nibble, munch, and crunch all their food up in no time! Play together and work on colors, shapes, and animals with this collection of small games.

—description from the pbulsiher

Name: Schatzsuche im Wunderwald
Description:
Treetop Treasure Hunt

The ingenious internal design of the board allows players to push the animals under the treetops and reclaim their stolen treasures. The player who best keeps a mental map of where their animals are concealed and uses strategy to recover their missing treasures first wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Drache Funkelfeuer Glücksbingo
Description:
Lucky Dragon Bingo

Together with Dragon Sparky and his friends, players embark on an adventure to discover fiery volcanoes, mysterious treasure maps, and more! They’ll keep track of what they find by placing thunderstones on their bingo cards as they go. The first player to get four thunderstones in a row will call “Dragon Bingo” and win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Der Wolkenmacher
Description:
Cloud Maker

The Cloud Maker and the crow always cook up the most unbelievable weather together! But when the cloud maker is gone, the crow needs to do everything alone, unless the players are willing to help! With a little luck from the die and a good memory while looking for ingredient tiles, they can find all the ingredients for the three recipe cards and win the game before the Cloud Maker comes home.

—description from the publisher

Name: SDG Architect
Description:
SDG Architect is a competitive strategic game where players develop and implement a strategy to achieve sustainable development in their country by making efficient use of limited resources. SDG Architect supports public education about the Sustainable Development Goals.

—description from the publisher

How to Play
Players act as the leaders of neighboring countries responsible for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) as quickly as possible. At every round, players get resource cards based on their progress, and use them to implement interventions aimed at achieving the SDGs. By way of those interventions, players advance from level 0 to 3 for each SDG or “Goal”, and receive more resources to invest and further their progress.

Basic Setup
Distribute 17 tokens of the same color to each player; divide the resource cards by type and stack them on the outer part of the board; and place the Technology token on the globe in the center of the board.

To determine their starting level, players roll the die. The player with the highest roll rolls the die again and positions an initial token on the first intervention for the corresponding SDG number. The other players follow in a clock-wise direction, rolling the die in turns until all players have placed six tokens.

End of the Game
At the end of the game, the player who has progressed the most towards the SDGs wins: each level achieved for each Goal is counted as a point, and the first player to fully achieve any Goal is awarded two extra points. The game can be limited in time, in rounds, or can end when the first player achieves a certain level for all SDGs agreed by players at the start of the game. Reaching Level 1 for all Goals typically requires about 1 hour of play time; Level 2 two hours; and Level 3 three hours.

Name: Monster-Klatsch
Description:
Monster High-Five

Be quick and keep an eye on the different groups monsters on the tiles. Does the number of monsters in a group match the number rolled? If so, each player tries to be the first to high-five the correct monster hand. The person who collects the most monster tiles wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wer krabbelt da?
Description:
ï»¿Bashful Bugs

Which bashful bug is hiding under which flower? Once they’re covered up, players need to remember which bug is where. Try and remember which bug is under the flower the die shows. The player who collects the most bugs wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pinguflip
Description:
Penguin Flip

When mom penguin starts handing out fish popsicles, the penguin kids race from ice floe to ice floe to earn their treats. But whenever they jump off an ice floe, it always flips to the other side and reveals a new surprise. The first player to complete three laps with their penguin kid wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fury of Gozmar
Description:
In Fury of Gozmar, each player takes control of a group of ruthless and greedy goblins who, with the help of their pickaxe and sword, are fighting to be crowned lords of the underground world. On your way to victory, you will have to collect valuable gems, train goblins to prepare them for battle, conquer enemy zones, cast powerful spells and make irresistible offerings to calm the fury of Gozmar, a frightening demon living in the heart of the caverns.

Fury of Gozmar is a strategy game for 2 players, for ages 14 and up. Games take approximately 30-40 minutes to play.
The objective of this game is to defeat your opponent, either by conquering his goblin burrow, killing all his creatures or conquering a greater number of territories at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Kieszonkowe kasyno
Description:
The odds are even. Will you take a chance?

Roll some dice, match symbols to cards and gain points! You can discard a token to roll again. But look out! If you push your luck too far, you can loose everything.

Keep an eye on your opponents – they will try to steal your cards.
Kieszonkowe kasyno (Pocket Casino) is a dice game full of true emotions but without a risk of real bankruptcy!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Stitchcraft
Description:
Welcome to Azetta, where traveling merchants put on trade shows with enchanted tapestries to win the sales from shoppers. Stitchcraft is a two-player strategy card game that plays in 15 to 20 minutes where players have the same deck of 40 cards, 5 copies each of 8 colored tapestries, and are racing to have 7 of the 8 colors face up on the table or 4 copies of one color face up on the table.

Stitchcraft won the Implementation of Simplicity award at CinCityCon’s 2019 design contest for being easy to learn while retaining strategic depth.  Turns are composed of each player drawing a card and then taking two actions. An action can be either placing a tapestry from hand face down on the table OR taking a face down tapestry and flipping it face up, activating the power of that color. Each color has a unique effect based on the Pattern set chosen at the start of each game. If players ever get tired of one Pattern set they can simply change to a new Pattern for an entirely different play experience. Will you enter the market and prove to be the wiliest weaver?

—description from the designer

Name: Astro
Description:
Astro is a real-time action game for 2-8 players. An asteroid field rich with rare space ore awaits you. Can you collect enough to fill your cargo hold before your competition does? This action-packed space adventure will get your jets going.

SETUP:
To begin, separate all Blinks individually, and distribute them around the play surface to create an “Asteroid field.”
Your goal is to complete 6 missions by mining the asteroid field for colored ore. The ore color you're collecting is indicated by the color on your ship, and the number of ore needed to complete the mission is indicated by the number of flashing lights.

As you collect ore, your cargo bay will fill, then celebrate when the mission is complete. After completing each mission, make sure you are separated from any Asteroids, then double-click your Ship to be given a new mission.

Asteroids periodically update to display new ore, but only if they are alone. You are allowed to grab onto Asteroids that have connected to each other and separate them.
Disconnecting attached Asteroids

WIN CONDITION:
The first player to complete their final mission is the winner, and their ship will display a spinning rainbow celebration.
To reset your ship, long press to turn it back into an Asteroid, then long press again to return to Ship mode with a new set of missions.
                                                                                                                               Each player then grabs an Asteroid and long presses it. Those Blinks will become “Ships,” flashing brightly with their first mission color. All players hold their Blinks at the edge of the asteroid field and count down from 5. When they reach 0, the game begins.

GAMEPLAY:
There are no "turns" in Astro - all players are free to move and mine as quickly as possible. To move, slide your Ship around the play surface and attach to Asteroids containing ore that matches your mission color. When you attach, you will automatically begin mining. Ore will disappear from the asteroid and appear on your ship. Then you are free to disconnect and continue moving
                               
Astro is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Berry
Description:
BERRY

Blue. Red. Yellow. Make all Blinks one color on your turn or be the first to score 10 points and you win. This unique strategy game favors the clever and punishes the greedy.
Blue, Red, Yellow. This is the order the Blinks cycle.

SETUP:
Each player starts with 3 blue Blinks in their hand. To change the color of a Blink, click it once.

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns placing Blinks, connecting them together into a cluster. After placing their Blink, a player clicks each adjacent Blink, advancing it to the next color.
Attaching to 2 or fewer neighbors
If there are 3 or more adjacent Blinks, the player must also click the Blink they placed.
Attaching to 3 or more neighbors
After the first 6 turns, players begin each turn not by placing a Blink from their hand, but by removing a Blink from the cluster, then placing it in a new location.
Not all Blinks can be legally removed from the cluster at the start of a turn. Blinks with neighbors on opposite sides are “locked,” as are Blinks that, if removed, would fracture the cluster into more than
2 pieces.
SCORING:
Examples of locked Blinks
               At the end of each turn, the active player earns points for the presence of certain shapes in a singular color.

WIN CONDITION:
The first player to score ten or more points is the winner. However, if a player ends their turn with all 6 Blinks set to the same color, they are the winner.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bomb Brigade
Description:
Bomb Brigade is a tense, high-stakes game of chance where players must rely on their quick reflexes and courage to survive. There is really only one rule: don’t blow up.

SETUP:
Connect all the Blinks together and long press one, sending them all into setup mode. In setup mode, Blinks display a slowly shifting rainbow. Arrange the Blinks into a starting arrangement, then double-click a Blink to turn it into a Bomb. All neighboring Blinks will automatically become Shields.
Starting arrangements can be simple, as shown above, but can also be larger or more complicated and include multiple bombs.

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns ‘sparking’ the Bomb by pressing it once. With every spark, there is an increasing chance that the Bomb will explode. In addition, each time the Bomb is sparked the spinning gets faster and faster.
Sparking the Bomb

If you can time it correctly, you should try to only spark the Bomb when its light is facing a shield. If the bomb explodes into a Shield, that Shield takes damage.
Bomb explodes, damaging Shield

Damage is indicated by a Shield changing color from green to yellow to orange to red. A Shield that takes 4 damage is destroyed, and displays a flashing rainbow pattern. Destroyed Shields should be removed from the board.

If the Bomb explodes on a side with no Shield, the player who sparked the Bomb ‘blows up’ and is out of the game. Double-click the exploded Bomb to reset it.
Bomb explodes on an empty side

WIN CONDITION:
The last player remaining after all others have been blown up is the winner.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flic Flop
Description:
It's shuffleboard from the future! Flick your Blinks across the table to score points, and take advantage of your opponent's mistakes to further your lead. You'll need accuracy, timing, and finesse to win this kinetic tabletop game.

SETUP:
Blinks begin the game as unscored Flickers, which appear as a spinning white light. Set three Blinks aside, then evenly distribute the remaining Flickers to all players. Assign each player one of three colors: magenta, cyan, or yellow.
Take the Blinks you set aside and long press them. This will turn them into Floppers, which appear as fully colored Blinks, periodically cycling magenta, yellow, and cyan. Long pressing a Flopper when alone will return it to a flicker.
Turning a Flicker into a Flopper
Take all three Floppers and combine them into a single cluster. Place the cluster about 3 feet away from the players (i.e. the other end of a short table) and in front of a backstop such as the game box. The further away you place the Flopper, the more challenging the game will be.
Creating a cluster of Floppers

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns sliding their Flickers towards the Flopper. Attaching to the Flopper will score the Flicker for the team color being displayed. A scored Flicker that has been connected displays a single dot of its scoring color and an entire half Blink of the current Flopper color. That Blink is now an extension of the Flopper, so Flickers that attach to it will score for the color of the Flopper.


Some Flickers may not attach at all when thrown: these are left where they are. They are still active, and may be knocked into the cluster by other players’ Flickers.
After every Flicker has been thrown, pull the unattached flickers aside, then separate the scored Flickers. This will make them display their scored color. Count the amount of your color and add that to your score tally. Double-clicking a Flicker in this state will reset it back to an unscored Flicker, ready to be distributed to players and thrown in the next round.
                                                                                                         
WIN CONDITION:
The first player to reach 11 points is the winner. If two players end a round with 11 or more points, the player with the most points in total is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers – Cream Racer Expansion
Description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Racer expansions. Each Racer brings unique "Abilities" and "Powers" of their own to the game. Collect ALL 13 Racer Expansions for the ultimate Sonic collection!

—description from the publisher
