Name: Fracture
Description:
Fracture is a new kind of territory control game where players fracture and rebuild the entire board on each turn. From a simple set of rules emerge surprisingly complex strategies.

SETUP:
Distribute Blinks evenly to all players (minimum 4 Blinks/player). Each player chooses a team color and sets their Blinks to that color by double-clicking. Once all players are set, recombine all Blinks into a starting arrangement with colors segregated.

GAMEPLAY
The object of this game is to make your Blinks “happy.” In order for a Blink to be happy, it must be:
a) touching at least two other tiles, AND
b) not touching a tile of its own color

On their turn, a player makes a fracture by splitting and separating the cluster into two smaller clusters. The clusters can be of any size; they do not have to be equal. You can choose to only move a single Blink, and you can move any tile, not just the ones of your own color.

Fractures must be able to be slid into and out of place while remaining flat on the table. They also cannot split the board into more than 2 halves.

The player then reconnects the two clusters in any way they choose. Once a player has finished their move, play passes to the next clockwise player.

WIN CONDITION:
The game ends when, at the end of a turn, a player has made all of their own color Blinks happy. In games with neutral Blinks, they must make all neutral Blinks happy as well.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Speed Racer
Description:
Your car is speeding down the road to nowhere. You’ve got to keep building as fast and furiously as you can, or you’re headed for a dead end. How long can you last in this endurance challenge?

SETUP:
Separate the Blinks so each piece resets to a loose road, indicated by spinning orange lights. Connect the Blinks together in a single line, then double-click any Blink to create a playable road.
Extend your road by connecting loose roads at the endpoint indicated by a red light. You must connect to the red side- connecting to any other side will not create a thru road.
                      
You can also attach built roads together by connecting their red lights.
                                                                                    Road setup process
Click any connected road piece to start a car. Single- clicks will create standard cars, and multi-clicks (3 or more) will create faster and faster cars.

GAMEPLAY:
Cars will travel from Blink to Blink, constantly increasing in speed. If your car reaches the end of the road, it will crash in a fiery wreck.
Car traveling and crashing
To keep your car from crashing, extend the road in front of the car using available Blinks.
Connecting two existing road segments

WIN CONDITION:
There is no finish line in Speed Racer - eventually, every car crashes. The question for you is how far and how fast can you go? Race side-by-side with your friends or set up time trials.

—description from the publisher

Name: 理の理 (Ri no ri, Logic and Psychology)
Their Own Game: Australian Football
Description:
Solitaire statistical replay of Australian Rules Football. Charts and dice game. Quick play.
Teams are rated for attack and defence. A comparison is made to arrive at the number of chances a team has to score. Each team has a percentage rating to convert each chance into either a goal (6 points) or a behind (1 point).
A single game takes around 10 minutes to set up and roll out. A season considerably longer.

Name: Takeaway Dice
Description:
This dice game is designed for the Blinks system allowing competitors to take dice and bet on results.

SCORING:
Each Blink is worth the amount of points shown on its face (1-6). If you have more than one Blink with the same face value, the duplicates are instead worth 10 each. For example, a player with a 4, a 5, and a 6 has scored 15 points (4 + 5 + 6), while a player with 3 4s has scored 24 points (4 + 10 + 10).

WIN CONDITION:
The player with the highest point total is the winner.
While this game can be played with more than 2 players, it's recommended that you play with at least 5 Blinks per player for a competitive game. Also, experiment with starting arrangements for more interesting games. Finally, for more advanced play, limit each player to using the re-roll action only once per game.

SETUP:
12+ Blinks
5-10 Min.
Takeaway Dice is played using Widgets. Place your Blinks together in a cluster and set them all to the Dice Widget. Determine player order, then single- click a Blink to roll all the dice.
                                                                                                     Rolling the dice
GAMEPLAY:
On their turn, each player takes the following actions. First, they may (but don't have to) re-roll all the dice in the cluster. Then they must remove a Blink from the cluster and claim it for their own.

Not all Blinks can be legally removed from the cluster at the start of a turn. Blinks with neighbors on opposing faces are “locked,” as are Blinks that, if removed, would fracture the cluster into more than 2 pieces.
Examples of locked Blinks
Players take turns in succession until the last Blink has been claimed. At this point, players add up their score.

This Game is played with Blinks Widget.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flip Bet
Description:
Flip Bet is a bidding and press your luck game played on the Blinks System

SETUP:
Flip Bet is played using Widgets. Place your Blinks together in a cluster, and set them all to the Coin Flip widget. Assign Gold to one player and Silver to the other.

GAMEPLAY
Each turn, both players predict how many coins will flip to their color by speaking it aloud, ie "5 Gold" or "3 Silver". Press a Blink to flip all the coins.

If a player's prediction is lower than the amount of their color shown, they receive that many points. If their guess was higher than the amount shown, they receive no points. If a player is perfectly accurate, they receive that number of points, and their opponent cannot receive points that turn, even if they would have normally. In the event that both players guess perfectly, both receive their points.

WIN CONDITION:
Play continues until one player has scored an agreed upon number of points. The recommended point target is double the number of Blinks in play, but can be adjusted for longer or shorter games.

—description from the publisher

Name: WHAM
Description:
Set up your garden in any size and shape, then defend it from pesky moles who are up to no good. How long can you keep the increasingly aggressive pests at bay? Show them who's garden it really is. This board can be arranged any number of ways for variable difficulties.

SETUP:
Connect the Blinks in any arrangement, so long as they are connected. Double-click any Blink to begin the game.
Any mole that completely disappears into the grass will end the game, and the cluster will flash red. In addition, a player who gets three strikes will end the game. Double-click any Blink to return to setup and double-click once more to try again.


GAMEPLAY:
During the game, waves of red moles will pop out of the ground. Moles pop up fully red, but countdown quickly before fading to black. Before they disappear back underground completely, a player must click a mole to “whack” it. The mole will flash white, then that Blink will return to normal.
                                                                                    As the game progress, waves of moles will appear and disappear faster and faster. If at any time a player whacks a Blink that has no mole on it, they get a “strike,” shown as a flash across the garden.

WIN CONDITION:
If you are able to last for 30 rounds, the garden will flash white and you win! Double-click any Blink to return to setup.                                 Double-click to start

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Rise of Blitzkrieg: The Fall of France, 1940
Description:
On May 10, 1940, the German Army Groups A and B began their invasion of Belgium and the Netherlands. The Allies, who determined this to be an offensive based on the Schlieffen Plan, set up as planned a line of defense along the Dyle river in Belgium. However, the German main force, the Army Group A's armored forces, broke through the Ardennes forest, contrary to the Allies' expectations, and advanced behind the Allied forces and advanced quickly in Northern France towards the English Channel.

The Rise of Blitzkrieg simulates the Fall of France. One player is the German, the other the Allies, and the game starts with operations plans. Can the German player trap the Allied player who knows the historical facts? Can the Allied player use its military strength to stop the German invasion? This game challenges the players' operational skills.

—description from the publisher

Name: Triang Wars
Description:
Triang Wars is an innovative tactical board game for 2-8 players set in WW2 theme.
Become a General and command one of three armies fighting for victory. 
Train and recruit units, control and fortify area, capture three strategic points on the map and be sure that enemy will not invade your headquarter!
Use General’s special order to lead Your infantry to battle and use their unique skills to gain advantage. Get behind the wheel of legendary vehicles and unlock a special attacks like V1/V2 rockets, Katyusha or Air Strike. Hard decisions and exciting duels that’s a Triang Wars in a new innovative magnetic triangle world which will force You to think differently than usual!

GOAL OF THE GAME:
Defeat your enemies and become invincible Commander!
You Can achieve that in a 3 different ways during the game:

     collect 480 points and the battle is over
     capture all three strategic targets (bridge, factory, railway depot) and you Won
     conquer your enemy’s Headquarter and he will surrender immediately


THREE PHASES:
Each turn of the game have 3 special phases:

     Recruitment:


  Train, recruit and chose wisely which unit will go first! Each of 3 armies Can use a tank, airplane, transport vehicle and infantry like sniper, bomber, gunner and medic. Every unit has unique skill and offensive/defensive statistic.

     Movement:


  Move your army to take over area and strategic targets. Fortify area to gain points and make your enemy move slower and yours faster or just gain some speed and leave area neutral. Repair damaged vehicles, heal wounded infantry, put your soldiers into transport vehicles to reach the front faster.

     Attack:


Use two attack types: more powerful but less precise or more precise but less powerful.
  Distance to enemy  + unit stats and skills + good attack type + dice roll, thats a receipt for a succeed attack where enemy will not be able to fightback.

COMPONENTS:
A heavy metal magnetic board with pre WW2 European map which is covered by triangle grid where players move and fight. 
On each side of the board there are three action fields which responds to player unit status: defeated => under training  => ready for recruitment.
Around the board a score counter to mark gained points (from 10 to 480 points).
210 magnetic triangle tokens to mark controlled area (70 per army).
Each 21 units are represented by dual-side 8x12cm cards and magnetic triangle tokens to reflect their position on the map.
3 special attack dual-side cards (two levels) and 1 dual-side card of cannon which Can be captured at railway depot.
12 General cards, each with special order to be used once per turn.
80 round tokens to mark points, special skills, damage, wounds or unit elimination. 
6 tokens of heavy aircrafts ammo.
1 initiative card
2 dice to determine attack results.

GAME MODES:
In standard game mode Player as a Commander takes control over whole army but in additional mode as a private Can manage a single infantry unit as a member of the team up 8 Players game (4 players per team).

—description from the publisher

Name: Articulate! Phrases
Description:
The mechanics remain the same as in the original Articulate!, but rather than you're partner/team having to guess a single word, they have to guess a number of phrases or proverbs from cards drawn within a specific time limit (provided by a sand timer). The team then move their pawn a number of spaces around a board dependent upon the correct number of phrases they guessed. The board spaces determine the next rounds subjects from the cards drawn - Everyday, Pot Luck, Sayings, Leisure and a Free-For-All space. The winner is the first team to cross the finish line by making a circuit of the board, and then being first to answer the Free-For-All question.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Realms: Interceptor Promo Card
Description:
A promo card for Star Realms.

Interceptor

Faction: Trade Federation
Cost: 2
Primary Ability: Draw a card
Faction Ability: Authority (4)
If Trashed:  Combat (3)

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Ogre Team Booster
Description:
You might not imagine Ogre culture to be especially egalitarian, but both male and female Ogres play Blood Bowl with equal gusto in the Ogre Kingdoms. Ogre women have a similar build and temperament to Ogre men, including that crucial aptitude for grievous violence.

If you're looking to field the maximum number of Ogres on your team, these two distinctive sculpts will keep them from looking the same. They mix and match perfectly with the Fire Mountain Gut Busters, plus you get an extra Gnoblar to kick around!

This 16-piece resin kit builds two Ogre players and one Gnoblar. They’re supplied with 1x 25mm bases and 2x 32mm bases.

Rules for using these models in your games of Blood Bowl can be found in issue 8 of Spike! Journal.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mayhem at the Rockport Zoo
Description:
The power at the Rockport Zoo has failed and the zoo's state of the art gate system has malfunction. Animals are on the loose and the mayhem begins. It is up to the maintenance worker and the zoo keeper to contain the animals and restore power back to the zoo. If you can get the maintenance worker to the maintenance shed to restore power, you win! If more than three animals escape or if either person run out of health points, you lose.

Mayhem at the Rockport Zoo is a roll and write game where you roll four dice to determine which animals will escape and one die for the direction in which they travel.

Both the zoo keeper and the maintenance worker have two actions per turn. The only way to contain the animals is to close the gate or tranquilize the animals.

With five exits and twelve types of animals, the race is on to protect the public. Each turn the danger will escalate and as the game progresses, the animals can travel greater distances. There are enough traps outside of the zoo to only catch three animals should they escape. If a fourth one escapes, the mayhem spreads outside of the zoo and you lose the game.

Entry for the 2019 Roll and Write contest

—description from the designer

Name: Universal Fighting System: Cowboy Bebop Collectible Card Game
Description:
A game in the Universal Fighting System represents a battle between two adversaries. Each player controls one of the two characters, with the objective being to defeat the opponent, typically through loss of vitality. The two characters need not be from the same universe.


for Cowboy Bebop

In 2071, roughly fifty years after an accident with a hyperspace gateway made the Earth almost uninhabitable, humanity has colonized most of the rocky planets and moons of the Solar System. Amid a rising crime rate, the Inter Solar System Police (ISSP) set up a legalized contract system, in which registered bounty hunters chase criminals and bring them in alive in return for a reward.

The Cowboy Bebop Booster Display contains 24 booster packs of 10 cards each for The Universal Fighting System (UFS).

https://jascogames.net/product/ufs-set-28-cowboy-bebopbooster-display/

--description from the publisher

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Power & Reality
Description:
Kicking off an all-new, MCU-based story arc called Assemble, this 1st issue, expands on the movie content for Vs. System 2PCG (See MCU Battles, Heroes, Villains). In this exciting expansion, Earth hangs in the balance, as the peacekeeping program-turned-technological terror known as Ultron, squares off with an assembled collection of fan-favorite heroes like the unparalleled marksman—Hawkeye and the physically enhanced assassin —Winter Soldier; all brought together to serve your deck by the irrepressible Power and Reality Infinity Stones.

Game Unit:

     55 Playable Cards
     1 Rulesheet


—description from the publisher

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Space & Time
Description:
Cosmic characters unite in this second installment to the Assemble story arc expansion for Vs. System® 2PCG®! A powerful and well balanced roster of good and evil, from Odin to Thanos. Join the fray in this MCU-based set that boats iconic imagery from several Marvel movies, joined together for eternity by the Space and Time stones.

Game Unit:

     55 Playable Cards
     1 Rulesheet


—description from the publisher
